subject: Boxing
lead_paragraph: With his stunning seventh-round knockout of the undisputed middleweight champion Jermain Taylor on Saturday night, Kelly Pavlik (32-0, 29 knockouts) is suddenly in control of his immediate future. That could include a date with John Duddy of Ireland in New York around St. Patrick’s Day, or possibly in Wales against the undefeated super middleweight Joe Calzaghe.It may take awhile for the glow to wear off from Saturday’s victory in Atlantic City. Trailing on the judges’ cards after nearly being bludgeoned into submission early on, Pavlik hemmed Taylor (27-1-1) in a corner and knocked him out with a flurry of punches.
